definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Plenty of time to read my Bible and look for a loophole.
sentences.chinese: 足夠我來讀聖經和等待那個槍眼。

sentences.english: The napalm rolled over and down the front of the recessed embrasure.
sentences.chinese: 那一發凝固汽油彈滾落到了嵌壁槍眼的前方。

sentences.english: You are go to be a hit at the party.
sentences.chinese: 你會是宴會上最槍眼的人物。

sentences.english: It was framed by a small circle of blood a few inches below his breastbone.
sentences.chinese: 槍眼在胸骨下方几英寸的地方，四周都是血。

sentences.english: The sailor's head wrapped with tape and innumerable bullet holes on his back.
sentences.chinese: 水手頭上纏滿膠帶，背上有無數的槍眼。

sentences.english: Huang Jiguang stopped the enemy's bullets with his own body.
sentences.chinese: 黃維光用身子堵住敵人的槍眼。

sentences.english: Both died very brutally, the captain with both hands handcuffed together, and two bullet holes in his abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 死的都很慘，船長雙手被手銬銬住，腹部有兩個槍眼。

sentences.english: The napalm rolled over and down the front of the recessed embrasure .
sentences.chinese: 那一發凝固汽油彈滾落到了嵌壁槍眼的前方。
